title: Saturn square Mars
summary: A tension between effort and constraint. Action meets resistance, forcing a confrontation with limits, pacing, and strategy. The task is to apply force intelligently rather than exhausting yourself against obstacles.

meaning.headline: Pushing harder isn't always the answer.

frames.text: Saturn-Mars squares expose where raw effort collides with structural limits, making inefficiency impossible to ignore.
This aspect asks for disciplined action-strength that's applied with awareness of constraints.
Frustration often arises when momentum is blocked by rules, timing, or capacity.
Endurance is tested more than speed.
This means you're stuck or destined to fail.

opportunities: Refining strategy instead of increasing force
Learning when to push and when to pause

do: Assess which obstacles are structural versus temporary.
Redirect effort toward what can actually move.
Pace physical and mental energy deliberately.
Build strength through consistency, not strain.
Respect limits without internalizing them as failure.
avoid: Ignoring signs of exhaustion or injury

reusable_lines.text: Strength works best when it's applied with awareness of limits.

forbidden_claims: Deterministic outcomes around failure or success

sources: Saturn-Mars square as effort/constraint tension archetype
